conclusion: Analyze the graph showing acceleration vs. time for both objects.
Graph shows acceleration on y-axis and time on x-axis; line represents acceleration over time.
Slope of the line indicates rate of change of acceleration with respect to time.
Graph shows a straight line indicating constant acceleration for both objects.
Slope of the line is positive, meaning both objects are accelerating uniformly.
Acceleration of both objects is constant over time.
Velocity is the integral of acceleration with respect to time.
For constant acceleration, velocity at time t is given by v = at.
Velocity of object A at time t1 is v_A = a * t1.
Velocity of object B at time t1 is v_B = a * t1.
Both objects have the same constant acceleration and start from rest, so their velocities at any given time t will be the same.
At time t1, both objects have the same velocity.
